benchmark_details.name: NoCode-bench
benchmark_details.overview: NoCode-bench is a benchmark designed to evaluate LLMs on real-world NL-driven feature addition tasks. It consists of 634 tasks across 10 projects involving about 114k code changes in total, each of which pairs a user-facing documentation change and the corresponding code implementation that can be validated against developer-written test cases.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess the capabilities of LLMs in no-code feature addition, simulating real-world development scenarios.

data.source: Collected from developer-maintained release notes of high-quality open-source projects on GitHub.
data.annotation: Manually validated by experts to ensure clarity and evaluation accuracy.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on task success comparison against ground truth patches and test outcomes.
methodology.interpretation: Higher success rates indicate better model performance in generating correct feature additions.
methodology.baseline_results: The best performing model achieved a success rate of 28.07% on the verified subset.
methodology.validation: Manual verification of task quality and evaluating clarity and accuracy.
